description: Valve has launched the Steam Spring Sale 2024 and with it, you know the drill, there's masses of discounts across all sorts of games. There's also a fresh list of the top 100 most played games on Steam Deck.
title: Steam Spring Sale 2024 live, Valve list the Top 100 games on Steam Deck

description: Sea of Thieves just got a big upgrade and with it Easy Anti-Cheat (EAC) is now online. Thankfully the developers have ensured it's enabled for Steam Deck / Linux players using Proton.
title: Sea of Thieves gets Easy Anti-Cheat - thankfully enabled for Steam Deck / Linux

description: Paradox Interactive today announced a brand new expansion to Stellaris with The Machine Age, that will have your society face new ethical and social dilemmas along with new threats.
title: The Machine Age expansion announced for Stellaris

description: In the ongoing saga of the Wolfire versus Valve lawsuit, which is continuing, we've been able to see a funny little look behind the curtain and Tim Sweeney was not happy with Valve.
title: Valve COO on Epic's Tim Sweeney "you mad bro?" when launching the Epic Store

description: In the ongoing saga of the Wolfire versus Valve lawsuit, which is continuing, we've been able to see a funny little look behind the curtain and Tim Sweeney was not happy with Valve.
title: Valve COO to Epic's Tim Sweeney "you mad bro?" when launching the Epic Store

description: Sunshine continues to improve for all of you who want good quality game streaming with Moonlight from one system to another, and release v0.22.1 is out now with multiple Linux improvements.
title: Sunshine game streaming app for Moonlight v0.22.1 out with more Linux improvements

description: This sounds really fun! RimWorld is getting a new horror-themed expansion named Anomaly, plus a free v1.5 update due at the same time.
title: RimWorld horror-themed Anomaly expansion and update 1.5 announced

description: Some potentially good (?) game industry news here, is that Embracer Group and Saber Interactive have split off with a purchase from Beacon Interactive, a company controlled by Saber Interactive co-founder Matthew Karch.
title: Saber Interactive splits off from Embracer Group taking various studios with them
